metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25219 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
url::recvline in url.cpp in libproxy 0.4.x through 0.4.15 allows a remoteHTTP server to trigger uncontrolled recursion via a response composed of aninfinite stream that lacks a newline character. This leads to stackexhaustion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libproxy-tools - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy0.4-cil - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy1-plugin-gsettings - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy1-plugin-kconfig - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy1-plugin-networkmanager - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy1-plugin-webkit - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
libproxy1v5 - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
python-libproxy - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
python3-libproxy - 0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libproxy package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.15-1ubuntu0.1').
